direction.raw_text: direct.  And I'm good.  I just did a play in Hollywood, and Victor Crowley praised its realism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  There's five-hundred guys in town who can tell me the same thing. You said on the phone you had some kind of "special qualifications." Ed takes a measured piuse.  This is his big revelation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Weiss, I've never told anyone what I'm about to tell you... but I really want this job. (he gulps) I like to dress in women's clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a fruit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, not at all!  I love women. Wearing their clothes makes me feel closer to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're not a fruit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, I'm all man.  I even fought in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (beat) 'Course, I was wearing ladies' undergarments under my uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta be kiddin' me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Confidentially, I even paratrooped wearing a brassiere and panties. I'll tell ya, I wasn't scared of being killed, but I was terrified of getting wounded, and having the medics discover my secret. Georgie sits back.  It's a hell of a story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is why you think you're the most qualified to make my movie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  I know what it's like to live with a secret, and worry about what people are gonna think of you... My girlfriend still doesn't know why her sweaters are always stretched out. Georgie shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, you seem like a nice kid, but look around you... (he gestures at the posters) I don't hire directors with burning desires to tell their stories. I make movies like "Chained Girls." I need someone with experience who can shoot a film in four days that'll make me a profit. (beat) I'm sorry.  That's all that matters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. BAR o DAY Ed sits morosely in a scuzzy bar, three empty shot glasses in front of him.  A BARTENDER ambles over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you gonna get something else? Ed glumly empties his pocket.  All he has is change.  Ed sighs, and staggers out. EXT. HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD - DAY Ed shuffles down the street, his head hanging low.  A restaurant door opens, and an EISENHOWER ERA NUCLEAR FAMILY exits.  Whitebread Dad, Mom, Son, and Daughter stride out in their starched clean clothes. They march obliviously past Ed.  He watches them go, then continues.  Ed reaches a building, "HOLLYWOOD MORTUARY," and glances in the window.  A pause, then he does a doubletake. THROUGH THE WINDOW The showroom is filled with sample coffins.  Lying inside one is BELA LUGOSI. ANGLE - ED He is flabbergasted. INT. HOLLYWOOD MORTUARY - SAME TIME Lugosi slowly sits up inside the coffin.  Bela is an aged 70- year-old man, once a great star, now a faded memory trying to hang on to his nobility.  Quite frail and tired, he is still a master of the grand gesture. An UNCTUOUS SALESMAN steps up.  Bela speaks, in a thick Hungarian ACCENT which gives him an Old World elegance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too constrictive.  This is the most uncomfortable coffin I have ever been in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, Mr. Lugosi, I've never had any complaints before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The selection is quite shoddy.  You are wasting my time. Mildly annoyed, Bela climbs out. He straightens his cloak and walks to the exit -- where be bumps into nervous Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Mr. Lugosi??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, I don't want any of your goddamn coffins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I don't work here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Bela peers at Ed, then glances confusedly over his shoulder at the salesman.  Oh.  Bela looks back at anxious Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?  What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want anything.  I'm just a really big, big fan.  I've seen all your movies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! Bela strides out. EXT. HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD - SAME TIME Bela hurries along.  Ed chases after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you buying a coffin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm planning on dying soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I'm embarking on another bus- andotruck tour of "Dracula." Twelve cities in ten days, if that's conceivable. Bela pulls out a large smelly cigar and lights it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I saw you perform "Dracula."  In Poughkeepsie, in 1938.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, that was a terrible production. Renfield was a drunk!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was great.  You were much scarier in real life than you were in the movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I waited to get your autograph, but you never came outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I apologize.  When I play Dracula, I put myself into a trance.  It takes me much time to re-emerge. A CITY BUS approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, there's my bus. (he checks his pockets) Shit, where's my transfer?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you bave a car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I refuse to drive in this country. Too many madmen. The bus pulls up, and the doors open.  Ed is worried he's about to lose his new friend.  He gets an idea...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. 1948 NASH RAMBLER - DAY Ed drives anxiously.  Bela sits next to him, filling the car with smoke from his big cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, Mr. Lugosi, you must lead such an exciting life.  When is your next picture coming out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no next picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, you gotta be jokin'!  A great man like you... I'll bet you have dozens of 'em lined up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back in the old days, yes.  But now
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: no one give two fucks for Bela. Bela puffs on his oversized cigar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're a big star!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more.  I haven't worked in four years.  This town, it chews you up, then spits you out.  I'm just an ex-bogeyman. (he points) Make a right. EXT. BELA'S NEIGHBORHOOD - DAY Ed drives past pumping oil wells and into a seedy neighborhood. They reach a tiny, well-manicured house.  Ed and Bela get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't want the classic horror films anymore.  Today, it's all giant bugs, giant spiders, giant grasshoppers -- who would believe such nonsense!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old ones were much spookier. They had castles, full moons...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were mythic .  They had a poetry to them. (he lowers his voice) And you know what else?  The women prefer the traditional monsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The women ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pure horror, it both repels and attracts them.  Because in their collective unconsciousness, they have the agony of childbirth.  The blood. The blood is horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never thought of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my word for it.  You want to "score" with a young lady, you take her to see "Dracula." Bela's eyes twinkle.  He reaches his front door and unlocks it. INSIDE... it's awful.  Squalid, dark, with skulls and strange voodoo objects scattered about.  Up front hangs a large photograph of shockingly young Bela, handsome and regal. Ed is stunned by this dismal place, but doesn't say anything. Within, DOGS start BARKING crazily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh, what a mess. (beat) My wife of twenty years left me last month.  I'm not much of a housekeeper. The dogs BARK louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh!  I'm coming!  I will feed you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I guess I should go.  Perhaps we could get together again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly.  But now the children of the night are calling me. Bela smiles and steps inside.  The door closes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. DOLORES'S APARTMRNT - DAY Dolores is in her 1950's kitchenette, making a green jello mold.  Ed bursts in, euphoric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweetie, you won't believe it!  I've got the most incredible news!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the job?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?! (confused) Oh, uh, no, I didn't get the job. But something better happened!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better than not getting a job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah!  I met a movie star!  Somebody really big !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?  Robert Taylor?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  A horror movie star!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boris Karloff!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close!  The other one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You met Basil Rathbone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, the hell with you.  I met BELA LUGOSI!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was dead. Ed's eyes pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  He's very alive.  Well... sort of.  He's old, and frail -- but he's still Bela Lugosi!  And he's really nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, I can't even remember the last time he was in a picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a shame.  He's such a rest actor, and nobody uses him anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So did you get his autograph? Ed calms down.  He smiles beatifically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  It wasn't like that at all.  It was just the two of us, and we were talkin'... and he treated me like -- a friend...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. STUDIO WAREHOUSE - DAY Ed is back in the plant department, arguing with his boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a bum .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No he's not!  Do you realize how much money he made for this studio over the years?  "Dracula"!  "The Raven"! "The Black Cat"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Well now he's a junkie.  He don't deserve to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true -- RUDE BOSS He's so great, you hire him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, uh, if I could I would... The guy takes a mocking face and struts out.  Ed glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BELA'S ROUSE - NIGHT It's Halloween night.  CHILDREN in trick-or-treating costumes parade up and down the streets.  Through Bela's window, we see him and Ed watching TELEVISION -- a small fuzzy screen in a huge console. INT. BELA'S HOUSE - SAME TIME ON THE TV, one of Bela's old '30s horror films plays.  Bela's evil character is hypnotizing somebody: His eyes stare the famous stare, then his hand does the famous hypnotic gesture. ON ED AND BELA They are entranced.  The men drink beers in silence.  Bela's TWO DOGS lie at his feet. ON THE TV The old movie suddenly stops, and VAMPIRA appears on the TV screen. Vampira, 25, is the sexy "Creature Feature" hostess, a pale ghoul slipped into a tight black dress. She leers in front of a corny fog-shrouded set.  There is a pumpkin, a broomstick, and a sign reading "Happy Halloween."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooo!  Those eyes!  He gives me the willies!  The only thing scarier than him is this guy I dated last week: Charlie from Pittsburgh.  Boy, talk about the living dead... ON THE MEN Ed is disgruntled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh!  I hate the way she interrupts the pictures.  She doesn't show 'em the proper respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think she's a honey.  Look at those jugs. Ed LAUGHS.  Bela waves his arm and starts doing his hypnotic hand gesture at the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampira!  You will come under my spell!  You will be my slave of love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Bela, how do you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must be double-jointed, and you must be Hungarian. (back at the TV) Vampira, look at me!  Stare into my eyes. Ed joins Bela in this activity.  The two of them wave their arms spookily at the TV. Bela becomes fatigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am getting tired.  I need to take my medicine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want me to get it for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you, Eddie.  I'll be alright. Bela smiles.  He gets up, shuffles across the room, and steps behind a curtain .  Ed is puzzled.  Bela's thin arm appears and draws the curtain tight.  We hear mysterious CLANGING, drawers opening and closing, and then silence. Ed sits, waiting. Behind the curtain, something DROPS.  We hear a muffled "Shit!" Ed is getting worried.  But then the curtain whips open, and Bela bounds out, grinning.  He's a bundle of energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel better now. AT THE DOOR The doorbell RINGS.  Kids SHOUT "Trick or treat!"  Bela jumps up gleefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children!  I love children. Bela puts on his famous cape, then gets a pair of fangs and sticks them in his mouth. OUTSIDE Little kids in Lone Ranger and Howdy Doody costumes giggle expectantly. Suddenly the door flies open, and standing there is Count Dracula!  The real Count Dracula.  YEOWWWW!!!  The kids SCREAM and run. Bela chuckles.  Every kid is gone... except one TOUGH BOY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you scared, little boy?  I'm going to drink your blood!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ehh, you're not a real vampire. You can't turn into a bat, and those teeth don't frighten me. Suddenly Ed lurches out, menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well how about these teeth ?!! Ed RIPS HIS TEETH out of his head and thrusts them at the kid.  The boy SCREAMS in terror and races away. Bela is wowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how'd you do that? Ed smiles impishly, then sticks the teeth back in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dentures.  I lost my pearlies in the war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - LATER THAT NIGHT Ed and Bela run toward us, Bela's cape flapping in the wind. Ed takes a swig from Bela's flask.  They're a bit tipsy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure this is okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  I do it every Halloween. EXT. CEMETERY - NIGHT The moonlight shines down on a rickety old cemetery.  The wind blows hauntingly, and tombstones gleam in the blackness. Ed and Bela reach the locked gates.  They glance at each other, then start to climb over.  Ed helps Bela.  They jump down, and Ed peers nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what? Bela looks like a child on Christmas morning.  He takes another swig, then starts running giddily. He disappears into the cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am DRACULA! Bela darts happily through the graves. His cape flies behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the BAT!! Ed's eyes light up.  He starts chasing after Bela. Bela's heart is racing.  He zig-zags past ancient crypts. Gargoyles peer down.  The wind howls through the skeletal trees, silhouetted against the cloudy sky. Ed runs through the shadows, trying to catch up. Bela flaps his cape up and down.  We almost think he's going to fly. Ed races up, then quietly stops.  He eagerly watches Bela, practically expecting him to turn into a bat.  It's a magical, crazed moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am DRACUlA!  I will LIVE FOREVER!!! Bela laughs, then lies down on the grass. WIDE Ed slowly walks over and lies next to Bela.  They're happy, eyes alert, on top of the world. Ed peers in wonder at his new friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SCREEN CLASSICS OFFICE - DAY Ed sits across from Georgie.  Ed's very excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the big news you couldn't tell me over the phone... again? Ed gulps excitedly.  He has a spiel all planned out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Weiss, I was thinkin' about what you said, about how all your movies have to make a profit.  And I realized, what's the one thing, that if you put in a movie, it'll be successful??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Better than tits -- a star ! Georgie shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, you must have me confused with David Selznick.  I don't make major motion pictures.  I make crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but if you took that crap and put a star in it, you'd have something!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Crap with a star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  It would be something better! Something impressive .  The biggest moneymaker you've ever had!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, maybe you're right.  But it doesn't friggin' matter.  I can't afford a star, so I don't even know what we're talking about. Ed grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I told you you could have a star for $1000??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Ed opens his valise and whips out an 8x10 GLOSSY OF BELA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lugosi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! Lugosi !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't he dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's not dead!  He lives in Baldwin Hills.  I met him recently, and he wants to be in our picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah.  Our picture. Georgie mulls this over.  He's interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would Lugosi want to be in a sex-change flick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he's my friend . Georgie stares carefully at Ed, then finally smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, fine!  You can direct it. I want a script in three days, and we start shooting a week from Monday. ANGLE - ED He leaps up euphorically.  He eagerly pumps Georgie's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you!  Bless you, Mr. Weiss! I promise I won't let you down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ED'S APARTMENT - DAY CU on a ROYAL TYPEWRITER.  Ed's hands whirl across the portable typewriter, frantically feeding in pages as fast as be can type.  We PULL OUT. Ed sits on the bed, typing.  He's a blur of activity, juggling a cigarette, coffee, and a telephone, while he writes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Bunny, you're perfect for this job!  You're so good at organizing. His adrenalin is pumping.  Ed pours some booze into his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know these people.  I need all the transsexuals and transvestites you can get. (he sucks on his cigarette) No, I don't care if they're not actors.  I want realism.  I want this film to tell the truth !  I've waited my whole life for this shot, and I'm not gonna blow it. There's a KNOCK at the door.  Ed carries the phone on a long cord and answers it.  Bela hurries in, smiling broadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, you got a new movie for me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's gonna be a great picture! You'll love your character! (back into the phone) Bunny, Bela's here.  Look, hit the bars, work some parties, and get me transvestites! I need transvestites ! Ed hangs up and resumes typing.  Bela is puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, what kind of movie is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, It's about how people have two personalities.  The side they show to the world, and then the secret person they hide inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, like Jekyll and Hyde!  Ah, I've always wanted to play Jekyll and Hyde!  I'm looking forward to this production. Ed stops typing.  He pours Bela a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ehh, your part's a little different. You're like the God that looks down on all the characters, and oversees everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... you control everyone's fate. You're like the puppetmaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, so I pull the strings!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  You pull the strings -- (he suddenly gets a look) "Pull the strings"... hey, that's pretty good! Ed quickly starts typing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ED'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Ed and Dolores sit at a card table, finishing up dinner.  The dogs eat scraps below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wipe off your hands.  I've got a little surprise for you... (he smiles nervously) I finished my script. Ed anxiously pulls out a pile of pages.  Dolores looks in awe at the cover: "'GLEN OR GLENDA' By Edward D. Wood, Jr""
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, I'm so proud!  I'll read it as soon as I get home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'd really like to know what you think.  Why don't you go in the bedroom and take a look at it?  I'll Wait... There's an uneasy moment between them.  She senses something funny.  Dolores takes the script and goes into the bedroom. The door closes.  Ed starts pacing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. BEDROOM - LATER Dolores reads the script.  She finishes the last page, then looks up.  She is very shaken. Dolores stands.  She grabs the door and opens it. THROUGH THE DOORWAY Ed stands somberly in drag .  He's in a pantsuit, heels, and pink angora sweater. Dolores is totally rattled.  She struggles for a response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's where my sweater's been. Ed silently nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you been doing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since I was a kid.  My mom wanted a girl, so she used to dress me in girlie clothing.  It just kinda became a habit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ!  And you never told me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my way of telling you -- DOLORES (furious) What, by putting it in a fuckin' script, for everyone to see?!  What kind of sick mind would operate like that? Ed is terribly hurt.  Dolores shakes tht script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what about this so-called "Barbara" character?  It's obviously
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I'm so embarrassed!  This is our life !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is.  And that's why you should play the part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh!  You got nerve, buddy. He calmly points at the script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a damn good role.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugh!  How can you act so casual, when you're dressed like that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes me comfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, just like in the script! Ed smiles serenely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. (he takes her hand) So what do ya say?  Do you wanna break up... or do you wanna do the movie with me? Dolores sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's good to have a job.  Now I can get my phone reconnected. In a corner, Georgie angrily waves the script at Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought this was gonna be a sex- change film!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's still a sex-change -- GEORGIE Yeah!  Five pages right before it ends!  The rest of the show is about some schmuck who likes angora sweaters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think he's a schmuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's with this new title?!  My poster says "I CHANGED MY SEX"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So change the poster.  Trust me, you'll be better off.  This is a story that's gonna grab people. (he goes into a pitch) It's about this guy.  He's crazy about this girl but he likes to wear dresses.  Should he tell her? Should he not tell her?  He's torn. George, this is DRAMA. Georgie throws up his hands
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, shoot whatever baloney you want!  I give up.  Just make sure it's seven reels long .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. STREET - EARLY MORNING We are on location for Ed's first film!  A SMALL CREW of a dozen unpacks the camera and reflectors from their cars.  Ed's voice rises above the hubbub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, could I have everyone's attention?!  Could you gather around? I've got something to say. The crew members put down their things and gather in a circle. In the middle, we reveal Ed, in complete drag.  Dress, nylons, pumps, lovely blonde wig... he's quite a sight.  Like an eager Scoutmaster, he addresses his troops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody, we're about to embark on quite a journey.  Four days of hard work... but when it's over, we'll have a picture that'll entertain, enlighten, and maybe even move millions of people. A COUPLE GRIPS glance at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now the only way we're gonna achieve all this is if we stay on schedule. Day one -- TODAY -- we'll start easy. We have eighteen silent scenes that can be shot quickly: Cars parking, Patrick's suicide, me strolling as a man, me strolling as a woman, etc. (beat) After lunch, we'll bring in the Inspector and the Doctor.  The Doctor is very important to the plot, so we might have to spend time on retakes. But it's worth it.  Scene totals for the first day is thirty-four. (he catches a breath) Day Two, we'll be a little busier -- Veteran CAMERAMAN BILL, an old guy with thick glasses, speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me Eddie, I don't mean to interrupt... but I'm gettin' a little worried about those clouds. He points up.  Everybody looks at the sky.  The clouds are gray. Ed nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three and Four later.  Now let's get that first shot off!  It's Scene 17, Glenda looking in the window. THE CREW disperses.  Ed quickly runs in his heels over to the burly make-up man, HARRY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, do I need any touch-up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling ya, eyelashes are the way to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, we've discussed this a million times.  I don't want to look like a girl.  I want to look like myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.  Then you look beautiful . Harry humorlessly powders Ed's nose.  Ed turns away and suddenly SHOUTS into a giant megaphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  ROLL CAMERA!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rolling. WIDE Ed chucks the megaphone and runs crazily past the camera and behind a building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And -- ACTION! A pause, and then Ed, in character as Glenda , calm and dignified, steps out and walks down the sidewalk. Ed stops at a store window.  He's totally in shadow. A grip grimaces.  He TURNS ON a light Ed lights up.  He looks in the window, admires a dress on display, then silently walks out of frame. A beat.  Ed SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, CUT!  PRINT IT!  LET'S MOVE ON!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you want a second take, for protection?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's to protect?  It was perfect! Suddenly a police car turns the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cops!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have a permit.  RUN! Everyone grabs equipment and takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. LARCHMONT STUDIOS - DAY The company is now shooting inside a dinky soundstage.  There are dirty mattresses tacked on the walls.  They prep Bela's set: A fishnet-draped armchair in front of a flat.  Ed is perched high in his director's chair, back in men's clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The set doesn't look right!  It looks too... empty.  Clutter it up.  Put a skeleton in the corner.  And what's that thing over there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it looks good.  Let's use it! Georgie hurriedly strides over.  He holds the script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed!  What's with these revised pages?!  A scene in a smelting factory?  A buffalo stampede?? Three-hundred soldiers storming Anzio Beach ??!  What's going on here?  I can't afford to film this nonsense!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  We're not gonna film any of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know a guy in Universal's stock house -- he's giving me the footage for free.  This movie's gonna look like a million bucks. Georgie nods.  Oh, okay. O.S. VOICE Mr. Lugosi has arrived! Ed jumps excitedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God! (he YELLS) Mr. Lugosi is here!  Now everyone, when he walks on the stage (nobody is listening; so Ed uses his MEGAPHONE) Now everyone, when he walks on the stage, treat him normal.  I know Bela Lugosi is a world-famous star, and you're all a little excited, but we're professionals.  So if you treat him with respect, everything will be alright. AT THE STAGE DOOR The door swings open, and Bela strides in, looking dapper.  He glances at the teensy stage, and his face falls imperceptibly. Ed runs up, bounding with enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela! It's so great to see you! (he glances at his watch) And eight o'clock on the dot.  Right on time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am always on time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course!  Well, we got a big day planned for you... First, we're gonna start off a little easy, with you in that armchair over there.  Then, once you're up to speed and cooking, we'll reset and bring out the laboratory equipment -- BELA (he leans in and WHISPERS) Uh, Eddie, do you have my money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?!  Oh yeah, of course. Ed and Bela step over to a corner. ACROSS THE ROOM From a distance, Ed pulls a wad of money from his pocket and peels off a few bills for Bela.  The crew watches, fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LATER Bela is seated in the ratty armchair on the set.  Harry does his make-up.  Harry glances at Bela's arm, and it is full of TRACK MARKS.  Harry grimaces, but doesn't say anything. Conrad eagerly scurries up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Lugosi, I know you're very busy, but could I have your autograph?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Conrad hands him a scrap of paper.  Bela signs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know which movie of yours I love, Mr. Lugosi?  "The Invisible Ray." You were great as Karloff's sidekick. Bela's face suddenly hardens.  He snaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Sidekick"??  "KARLOFF"?!! Bela insanely RIPS up the autograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you!!  Karloff doesn't deserve to smell my shit!  That limey cocksucker can rot in hell, for all I care!!! WIDE Ed panickedly runs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?!  Jesus, Connie, what did you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothin'!  I told him he was great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dare that asshole bring up Karloff?!!  You think it takes talent to play Frankenstein?!  NO!  It's just make-up and grunting!  GRRR!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's not the issue !! (she suddenly stops)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. SCREEN CLASSICS - DAY The hallway is filled with eager TRANSVESTITES.  It's a very festive atmosphere, and Bunny tries to create some order. Inside the busy office, Paul types, and Conrad cranks a mimeograph machine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good thinkin' .  We'll talk about Days
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then how's it gonna get in the picture ?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !  GRRR! Ed is frozen in fear.  He glances across the stage. Georgie is flabbergasted.  He points urgently at his watch. Ed nods.  He motions to Conrad: Get out of here.  Conrad runs away.  Ed leans in to Bela.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right, Bela.  Now Dracula, that's a part that takes acting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course!  Dracula requires presence .  It's all in the voice, and the eyes, and the hand -- Bela waves his outstretched arm.  Ed tries to calm him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you seem a little agitated. Do you maybe wanna take a little break, go for a nice walk... and then we'll come back and shoot the scene?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I am ready now!  Roll the camera!! The crew is baffled.  Ed shrugs at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, okay... roll camera
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rolling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sound!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark.  Scene Thirty-One. The Assistant CLAPS the slate in front of Bela, then runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And... action? It's dead quiet.  Nobody knows what's about to happen. WE MOVE IN TO BELA.  And... he suddenly assumes character. Like the consumate pro he is.  Bela gets a wicked, sinister leer, then starts intoning threateningly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Beware.  Beware!  Beware, of the big green dragon that sits on your doorstep.  He eats little boys! Puppy dog tails!  Big fat snails! Beware.  Take care.  Beware!" CLOSEUP - ED He is blown away.  He quietly mumbles in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brilliant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. STAGE - NEXT DAY Dolores studies her script, as the crew lights a flimsy kitchen set.  Ed strolls past, nonchalantly removing a ladies' wig and earrings.  She stares in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you just walk around like that, in front of all these people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hon', nobody's bothered but you. (he gestures) Look around -- they couldn't care less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, this isn't the real world! You've surrounded yourself with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it a little louder.  I don't think Bela heard you in his trailer. Dolores quiets down.  She feels bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dolores.  I need your help...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FILMING IN PROGRESS - LATER A scene is being shot, on camera.  Ed (as Glen) and Dolores (as Barbara) stare into each other's eyes.  He's dressed normal, and she wears a fuzzy angora sweater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My mind's in a muddle.  I thought I could stop wearing these things. I tried, honestly I tried..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Glen, I don't fully understand this. But maybe together -- we can work it out." She stands up, dramatically takes off her angora sweater, and gives it to Ed. He holds it meaningfully, then smiles proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music swells... and CUT and PRINT IT! Ed and Dolores hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. EDITING ROOM - DAY On a MOVIOLA, we see the black-and-white image of Dolores taking off her angora and giving it to Ed. WE PULL OUT.  Ed and Georgie are hunched over, watching the movie.  Ed smiles proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we fade out.  "The End." (the film runs out) What do you think? Georgie peers at his watch.  He shakes his bead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's fifty-seven minutes long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?  Whatever.  So did you like it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, what was the one thing I asked you to do?  Make it seven reels long . I've got contracts with my exhibitors.  If it ain't over an hour, they won't play it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, I used every frame of film we shot.  Maybe they won't notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll notice. (beat) Look, why don't you let me take over from here?  I can do a few tricks: Pad it out with more stock footage, add establishing shots...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, I guess -- GEORGIE Good.  And one more thing.  I think your "Written, Directed, and Starring Ed Wood" credit is a bad idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?!  I did all those things!  Hell, I even built the props.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you did a bang-up job, too.  But you don't want other producers to know that's you in drag.  Trust me. It's a career killer. Ed is quite upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm proud.  I wrote, directed, and starred in it just like Orson Welles in "Citizen Kane"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah??  Well Orson Welles didn't wear angora sweaters, did he??! Ed is beaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SCREENING ROOM - NIGHT It's the cast and crew screening!  The eager two-dozen people are packed into a tiny screening room. The lights dim, and the movie starts.  A LIBRARY MUSIC fanfare, and then: "Bela Lugosi in GLEN OR GLENDA" Everyone APPLAUDS excitedly.  Bela smiles. Credits continue: "Featuring Daniel Davis and Dolores Fuller" The audience is audibly baffled.  Bunny BLURTS out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daniel Who ?! Dolores leans in to Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, who is Daniel Davis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some weirdo who likes to wear dresses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LATER IN THE MOVIE ON-SCREEN, Dolores looks tenderly at Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Glen.  Is it another woman?" Ed as Glen nervously ponders his response. But suddenly -- MUSIC THUNDERS in.  The movie cuts to buffalo stampeding .  Bela's angry face is superimposed over this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Pull the string!  Pull the string!" IN THE AUDIENCE People are impressed by this technique.  Bela nods in approval. ON-SCREEN Out of nowhere, CHEAP JAZZ MUSIC starts, and the movie abruptly cuts to SLEAZY STAG PARTY-STYLE FOOTAGE!  A bare-chested man whips a bound woman!  A woman dominates another tied to a large stick!  A brunette violently rips off her dress and does a hoochie-coochie dance! IN THE AUDIENCE The crowd is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't shoot that! Ed looks back at Georgie, who's wearing a big satisfied grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georgie, what's with the stag footage??  You said you were cutting in establishing shots !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.  I established some tits and ass. Ed rolls his eyes.  He turns back to the movie. INT. PARTY - LATER THAT NIGHT Everybody is CELEBRATING, with a raucous party.  People are boozing it up.  BIG BAND MUSIC plays.  Ed dances with Dolores. Paul smokes a joint.  Conrad falls over a table and breaks a lamp.  Bela dances happily with a cute young REDHEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wasn't I something..?  Did you see how I command the screen?! Ed's giddy buddies stumble over with foaming glasses of beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, it was superb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A great show!  A little strange... but great -- especially my scenes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like I always promised.  Now you're among the immortals.  You're movie stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's to Ed.  For making us into something. It's a warm moment.  They all CLINK their glasses. Dolores kisses Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BUNGALOW HOUSE - DAY We're outside a cute little Spanish bungalow house.  Ed and Dolores are moving in.  They lug furniture from a rented truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From today on, our lives are different!  We'll be swimming laps in the same pool Jean Harlow did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  It's so much money...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who cares?!  We're on a ROLL!  These are the moments in life you're supposed to grab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Ed, we're not even married.  And you don't have a job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you do!  And anyway, I've got tons of new scripts.  And now that I have a track record, studios are bound to hire me! She just stares.  Ed shrugs, semi-reassuringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look on the bright side.  If we miss the rent, what's the worst they can do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toss us out on our ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. INT. BUNGALOW - DAY The house is moved in.  Ed's unkempt dogs run about.  Pumped-up Ed sits on the bed typing fiendishly fast while wearing an angora sweater.  A cigarette dangles from his mouth, and a bottle of booze lays in his lap.  Bela sits quietly nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout a western?  People love westerns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, I don't like horses.  Do I have to get on one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh, forget it.  What else is big? (his face lights up) Teenagers!  Jailbait pics!  Yeah... You got the juvenile delinquent, his girlfriend from the wrong side of the tracks -- BELA Who do I play?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, a cop.  NO!  You play the father. He's angry !  He doesn't like seeing his son -- no -- he doesn't like seeing his daughter behave this way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... can't I play the romantic part?  I'm tired of always being the bad guy.  You know, back in Hungary, I played Romeo!  I would like to be the lover again -- me, in a boat, with the girl... Ed considers this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  Romance, that's great!  To engineer your comeback, we're gonna need a whole slate of pictures.  Once "Glen Or Glenda" takes off, we'll slam you into one, then another, then another!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good.  I could use the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we need to start off with a bang! Something we know the audience will want to see.  Mmm.  What was your biggest hit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm... my biggest hit?  That would probably be "Dracula."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course! Ed crabs a pen and excitedly scrawls out the word "DRACULA." Bela frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those bastards at Universal.  I made so much money for them, and now I can't get the time of day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So let's make another "Dracula." Let's make "The Return of Dracula"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't.  Those sons-a-bitches control the rights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do?  Shoot.  There must be a way to get around that... Ed's mind is working.  He holds out the paper and stares at it.  Suddenly, he grins.  He grabs the pen and makes a period after the "DR."  It now says "DR.ACULA"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha-ha!  Dr. Acula!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dracula?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Doctor Acula !  You can still wear the cape, have the fangs... but you're a doctor!  Not a count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah!  This is very exciting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta type this up, while it's still fresh! Ed rips the paper from his typewriter, puts in a blank page, and starts typing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MOVIE STUDIO GATE - DAY We're outside the imposing gates of MGM.  The lion logo is overhead.  Ed drives up in his dirty Nash Rambler convertible. He wears his nicest suit.  Ed peers nervously at the GUARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, I'm here to see Mr. Feldman. The Guard stares suspiciously at Ed.  His filthy car is leaking oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward D. Wood, Junior. The man frowns.  He looks through his files -- then finds a parking slip with Ed's name.  He is surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.  Eh, he's in the Executive Building.  You can park in the reserved section. Ed smiles. INT. EXECUTIVE WAITING ROOM - DAY The room is very posh, with fancy paneling and marble floors. Ed sits nervously under posters for "GRAND HOTEL" and "QUO VADIS."  Film cans labled "Glen Or Glenda" rest in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, Mr. Feldman will see you now. She hits an electric button.  A large oak door swings open. INT. OFFICE Behind a giant desk is MR. FELDMAN, a glib, thin over- caffeinated man.  He jumps up, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Ward, it's a delight to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Wood.  Ed Wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wood?  Ward?  Wood. (puzzled, he glances at his appointment book) Hey, what do you know.  It is Wood. Dang secretaries, you can never get a good one.  Right? Ed shrugs.  Feldman grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you bringing me?  Looks like you got some film cans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Feldman, some people have resumes to show.  I've got my own movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?!  Well good for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just made this picture, over at Screen Classics.  It opens next week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screen Classics?  Hmm, don't know them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody in town has seen it, so I'm givin' you first crack at my talents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't wait to take a look. (he claps his hands) So what's up next? Ed leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Feldman, I don't believe in thinking small.  So I've got a whole slate of pictures for you: "The Vampire's Tomb," "The Ghoul Goes West"... and "Doctor Acula"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor Acula?  I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, "Dr. Acula."  I get it. (beat) I don't like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Bela Lugosi's in it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lugosi's washed-up.  What else you got? Ed grimaces.  Lugosi was 90% of his pitch.  He vamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I've got another project I wasn't gonna tell you about. Lugosi's in it, but he's got a smaller part.  The lead is an ingenue, a sterling young actress named Dolores Fuller.  The title is "Bride Of The Atom."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah!  Atomic Age stuff, huh?  I like it. (he smiles) I'll tell you what, Mr. Ward.  Why don't you leave those film cans, and my associates and I will take a look at your little opus.  Maybe we can do business together. Ed is elated. INT. STUDIO SCREENING ROOM - DAY Feldman and his fellow SMARMY EXECUTIVES sit in a plush screening room.  They are viewing "Glen Or Glenda." ON-SCREEN, Ed is in drag.  A SOLEMN NARRATOR within the movie speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Give this man satin undies, a dress, and a sweater... and he's the happiest man in the world.  He can work better, think better, even play better -- and be more of a credit to his community and his government." ANGLE ON THE EXECUTIVES They are stupefied.  Yikes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is this?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this an actual movie?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fuckin' ridiculous! Feldman squints at the screen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Acula ! Ed writes it out, "DR. ACULA," then waves it in Feldman's face. Feldman nods.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute .  That guy in the dress
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: he's the one I met with today! This must be a big PUT-ON! (he CHUCKLES) It's probably another one of Billy Wellman's practical jokes! Everybody suddenly starts HOWLING with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. NEWSSTAND - DAY Ed zooms up and chipperly jumps from his car.  He buys a "Los Angeles Herald-Express," eagerly opens it to the entertainment pages... and then gets a confused look.  Ed quickly starts rifling through the pages -- something is wrong. EXT. PHONE BOOTH - DAY Ed angrily shouts into the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georgie, what happened?!  I thought "Glen Or Glenda" was opening next week!  Where's the ads? An OLD-FASHIONED SPLIT SCREEN of Georgie on the phone appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Where's the ads"?!  The ads are in Alabama, Indiana, and Missouri!  You schmuck, it ain't gonna play L.A.!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I can't sell it to save my life!  You made a goddamn feathered fish.  Is it an art film, a horror show, a hygiene flick?  Nobody knows! I'm beggin' people to book it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it needs special handling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screw you, Wood!  I even sunk more money into different titles: "Transvestite" "He Or She?" "I Led Two Lives"... It DOESN'T MATTER! Nobody wants to see the piece of shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't talk that way about my movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Your movie"?!  I wish it was your movie!  I wish I hadn't blown every dime I ever made into this stinkbomb. If I ever see you again, I'll kill you!!! Georgie SLAMS down the phone.  His split screen WIPES off, leaving Ed standing alone. Ed stares at the phone, then quietly hangs it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. OLYMPIC AUDITORIUM - NIGHT WHAM!  A WRESTLER throws another WRESTLER at the mat.  The crowd CHEERS raucously.  We're at the Saturday Night Wrestling Matches! In the stands are Ed, Dolores, Bunny, and Bunny's new YOUNG MALE "FRIEND."  Seated around them are hollering truckers and ex-Marines.  Bunny giggles and nudges gloomy Ed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So guess where I'm going next weekend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mexico!  And guess what I'm going to do there?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno.  Lie on the beach?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  I'm getting my first series of hormone shots!  And once those babies kick in, they're gonna remove my organs, and MAKE ME A WOMAN! Ed is astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus!  Are you serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!  I've dreamed of it for years, but your movie made me realize I've got to take action.  GOODBYE, PENIS! The truckers nearby stare.  Dolores covers her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ssh!  Will you keep it down? The crowd suddenly ROARS and jumps up.  A favorite wrestler has entered the ring, massive TOR JOHNSON, 50.  Tor is an incredible sight: A bald, lumbering behemoth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now entering the ring, in the gold trunks, 350 bone-crunching pounds of pure strength, the "Swedish Angel"... Tor Johnson!!! The crowd goes apeshit.  The stands are going to collapse from the SHOUTING. Ed's eyes are the size of saucers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, look at that guy.  He's a mountain! The bell RINGS.  Tor quickly grabs his OPPONENT, a man in a blue mask, and throws him at the ground.  Then Tor jumps onto his stomach, easily picks him up, and heaves him at the ropes. People CHEER.  Ed is flabbergasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen anything like him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And once I'm a woman, Jean-Claude and I are getting married -- ED (eyes glued to the ring) Ssh!  He's so big!  He's a monster ! Can you imagine what that guy would be like in a movie? ON TOR He screams maniacally in Swedish.  Tor lifts the Opponent over his head and tosses him into the stands.  Three rows of chairs get knocked over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. WRESTLER'S BAR - NIGHT A tiny miniature European car pulls up.  Tor Johnson is squeezed inside -- ludicrously oversized for this vehicle.  Tor carefully wedges himself out and enters the bar. INT. WRESTLER'S BAR - SAME TIME This rowdy bar is packed with burly WRESTLERS.  Tor walks in, and men cheerily yell out: "Hey, Tor!" "Hi, Tor!"  Tor grins. In person, he actually seems a jolly, outgoing fellow. Ed waves from the corner
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Johnson, over here! Tor smiles and lumbers over
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad you could fit me in your schedule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Da pleasure be mine. They shake hands.  Ed's hands look like a baby's in Tor's giant mitts. Tor tries to sit in the booth.  But he can't fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could we moovf to table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, of course! Ed jumps up.  They move to a large table.  Now Tor is happy. He starts shoveling beer nuts into his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, Mr. Johnson -- TOR Tor!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tor.  Have you ever thought about becoming an actor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mm, not good-lookink enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're quite handsome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  With hair, yah.  But I must shave head for wrestlink.  It scare da crowds.  Dey like that. Ed smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I think you'd be a sensation in pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what bout accent?  Some people tink I haf too much accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, that doesn't matter!  It's a visual medium. A WAITRESS saunters over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tor, what can I get ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll haf eight beers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uhh, I'll have just one. She walks off.  Tor shakes the now-empty nut bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And more nuts! Ed tries to grab Tor's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So anyway, I've got this new script, "Bride Of The Atom," and there's a part you're ideal for: "Lobo."  He's tough.  A brute.  But he has a heart
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and at the end he saves the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like.  When do movie shoot?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hopefully, very soon.  I'm just awaiting the final okay from Mr. Feldman at MGM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ED'S BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT Ed and Dolores are asleep.  Suddenly the phone RINGS.  Ed fumbles for it and groggily answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wood Productions... We hear Bela's weak VOICE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie... help me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie... please come over -- CLICK.  The phone hangs up.  Ed is very alarmed. EXT. BELA'S HOUSE - LATE NIGHT The wind is blowing.  Ed's Nash roars up, and he jumps out, a coat over his pajamas.  He runs up and POUNDS on Bela's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela?! Ed tries the door. It's unlocked. INT. BELA'S HOUSE - SAME TIME Ed steps into the dark room, and is stunned by what he sees: Bela is slumped on the floor, pasty white, eyes glazed.  A rubber tube is tied on his arm, and a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE lies next to him. The dogs crouch behind him, whimpering, despondent, Bela looks up through half-opened eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela, what happened?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't feel well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me take you to the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No hospital.  Just take me to the couch... Ed nods.  He picks up the old man and carries him across the room to the couch.  The large portrait of Bela, young and robust, peers down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I call a doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah.  This happens all the time... Ed puts a pillow under Bela's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there anything I can get you? Water?  A blanket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goulash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how to make goulash. Ed sits next to him.  An awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in the needle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morphine, with a demerol chaser. (he starts crying) Eddie, I'm so broke.  I don't know what I'm gonna do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry.  I'll do something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. MOVIE STUDIO GATE - MORNING Ed stands outside MGM, talking into a phone at the guard gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Feldman!  I haven't been able to get through, so I just showed up. Yeah, out front!  So, are we gonna be working together? (his face slowly falls) Really ?  Worst film you ever saw...? (beat) Well, my next one will be better. (beat) Hello? INT. ED'S HOUSE - DAY Dolores tries to cheer up gloomy Ed.  He's wearing angora.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm no good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, it's just one man's opinion!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela needs a job... I can't even get a film going... (listless) But of course I can't -- I made the worst movie of all time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's ridiculous. Ed sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I wanna do is tell stories.  The things I find interesting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well maybe you're not studio kind of material.  Maybe you just need to raise the money yourself. Ed looks up. INT. BANK - DAY Ed sits opposite a LOAN OFFICER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The movie is called "Bride Of The Atom"... INT. DENTIST'S OFFICE - DAY Ed continues, pitching to three DENTISTS in white coats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...It will star Bela Lugosi.  Each of you would put up $20,000... EXT. PHONE BOOTH - DAY Ed stands at a busy intersection.  He YELLS into a phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's right. The Bela Lugosi. He's still alive. (beat) Huh?  Is he available Friday night? Gee, I suppose so... Why? cut TO: INT. TV STUDIO - NIGHT We're backstage at a '5Os variety show.  It's exciting live TV: Showgirls, techies, and cast members dart about in a state of hyped-up tumult. INT. DRESSING ROOM - SAME TIME Bela and Ed sit in his dressing room, running lines.  Bela is in his Count outfit: Cape, jet black hair, red lips, etc.  They both read off SCRIPTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Greetings.  I am the Count."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure." Audience laughs.  Applause.  "Say, that's a funny place to sleep."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "It is my home."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Oh, tract housing, huh?"  Laugh. "You need a new real estate agent."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Beg to differ.  This casket incarpratates, er, inporporates --" Ed interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No Bela, that's "incorporates."  Look, just say "This casket has..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ach!  How do they expect a Hungarian to pronounce this dialogue?  This live television is madness! An ASSISTANT knocks and sticks her head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five minutes, Mr. Lugosi. INT. BACKSTAGE - MINUTES LATER Ed and Bela stand in the wings.  Onstage is the SHOW HOST, a cheesy comedian.  He is doing a routine with Criswell, the famed psychic who opened this movie.  Criswell wears a tux and a turban and is acting mysterious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then what's gonna happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In 1960, the automobile will have retractable wings, so it can fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a heck of a way to beat traffic. Audience LAUGHS.  Criswell rubs his temples enigmatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By 1970, Man will have colonized Mars.  Millions of people will live there. Ed is mesmerized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow!  Ain't that something. INT. STUDIO - LATER We're out in the audience.  The curtain rises on a SPOOKY SET: Shadows, cobwebs, and a coffin in the center.  The Host walks onstage, to huge APPLAUSE.  He's playing his "Slick" character, a befuddled moron in a funny hat.  The Host shines a flashlight around, and then the coffin opens.  Bela sits up.  There's more APPLAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greetings.  I am the Count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greetings.  I am Slick Slomopavitz, Seeker of Adventure. The audience LAUGHS.  Then APPLAUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, that's a funny place to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is my home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, tract housing, huh? (he starts AD-LIBBING) I guess I shouldn't complain about my duplex in Burbank.  What a dump. Some places have a Murphy bed, this place has a Murphy shower .  I still don't know where to hang the towels! The audience HOWLS with laughter.  Bela is totally lost.  He seems incredibly confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, beg to differ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Beg to differ?!"  Hey, I'm talkin' about my duplex in Burbank!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Greetings.  I am the Count... BACKSTAGE Ed covers his face in embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. STUDIO HALLWAY - LATER The Host angrily storms past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you we should've gotten Karloff. He exits.  A door opens, and Ed and Bela quietly step out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela, don't worry.  You're better than all this crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said I could ad-lib...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about it.  We'll make our new movie, and you'll be a star again. They shuffle away... until Criswell and his snazzy ENTOURAGE burst around a corner.  Even in person, Criswell is ethereal and quite self-important.  He is delighted to see Bela.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Lugosi !  It is an unparalleled privilege to meet you.  Allow me to introduce myself... I am CRISWELL!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a pleasure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, cheer up!   Don't lose heart over what happened tonight. (he points at his temple) I predict that your next project will be an outstanding success!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who may you be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edward Wood, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah.  The director of "Glen Or Glenda."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: H-how'd you know?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Criswell.  I know all. Criswell winks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MOCAMBO ROOM - NIGHT Latin horns blast onstage of this hopping '5Os nightclub. Cigarette girls roam about.  Seated at a front table is Ed, Bela, and Criswell's group.  Everyone's plastered and laughing. Criswell shouts above the din at a WAITER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring me two more Beefeater martinis. Eddie will have another whiskey, Dagmar's a Rum-and-coke, Moustapha and King are chablis -- hey Bela, would you like a wine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I never drink -- wine. The whole table CRACKS UP.  Bela cheers up.  Ed turns to Criswell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Cris, how'd you know we'd be living on Mars by 1970?  How'd you know it wouldn't be 1975, or even
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eddie... my friend. Aghast, Ed runs over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I guessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made it up.  It's horseshit! Ed's jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no such thing as a psychic. People believe my folderol because I wear a turban and a black tuxedo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's that easy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, we're in show biz!  It's all about razzle-dazzle.  Appearances. If you dress nice and talk well, people will swallow anything. Criswell smiles knowingly.  Ed nods at this profound wisdom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BROWN DERBY - NIGHT We're outside the legendary hat-shaped restaurant.  A large Eldorado pulls up, and a CONSERVATIVE MAN and his PLUMP WIFE step out and approach the DOORMAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me.  We're here for the Wood party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, that would be in the Venetian Room, sir. The couple raise their eyebrows.  They're impressed. INT. BROWN DERBY - NIGHT A large banner says "BRIDE OF THE ATOM - NEXT YEAR'S SMASH HIT!" In a private back room, Ed is throwing a LAVISH BACKERS PARTY. All his riff-raff friends are dressed in tuxedos and gowns, strutting about with flutes of champagne like they're extras in "The Great Gatsby." Bewildered POTENTIAL BACKERS wander around.  Ed shmoozes them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna have the most terrifying monster ever seen on film!  A ghastly creature created from an atomic mutation!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like scary movies.  I go more for ones with love stories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's what this movie is ... a heartbreaking romance!  It's about a young reporter, Janet Lawton, in love with a young cop, Dick Craig. ACROSS THE ROOM Conrad and Paul sit in a corner.  Conrad has a shoe off and is scratching his foot.  Ed alarmedly runs over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think you're doin'?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These shoes are itchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't sit !  You gotta walk around, with good posture.  You want these people to think we have class. Otherwise they'll never invest in our movie. ACROSS THE PARTY Two AMAZED BACKERS have their hands around Tor's giant arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernie, get a load of this guy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biceps 22! Chest 62! Stomach 54!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whew!  You're quite a specimen. (beat) And you're gonna be in the picture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I play Lobo! ACROSS THE ROOM An excited HICK BACKER shakes Bela's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Lugosi, I can't believe I'm meeting you in person.  This is one of the most exciting moments of my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  And you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie Johnson!  I manufacture toothpaste tubes. ACROSS THE PARTY Criswell struts in the b.g., talking to someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I predict "Bride Of The Atom" will be the biggest moneymaker of all time! In the f.g., Ed introduces Dolores to a SOUTHERN BACKER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is lovely starlet Dolores Fuller, who will play Janet Lawton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how much will this picture cost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a normal studio it would be half-a-million, with all their wasteful overhead and fancy offices. But because we're more efficient, we can bring it in for seventy grand!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  Well I'll consider it... EXT. BROWN DERBY - LATER THAT NIGHT Ed and his buddies wave goodbye to the departing backers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye!  Goodbye!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how'd we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't make a dime. IN THE PARKING LOT A VALET hands the car keys to the Conservative Backer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's twenty-five cents, sir. The man glances at his Wife. She shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gave all my money to the babysitter. The man grimaces.  He checks his pockets, pulls out a handful of PENNIES, and counts them out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. ED AND DOLORES'S BACKYARD - DAY Ed sits in a chaise lounge by the pool, studying papers and drinking shots of whiskey.  He's in a woman's pantsuit and fuzzy slippers.  Dolores marches out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, the landlord called again.  He wants his money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him "Bride" is in pre- production.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, the landlord doesn't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the problem! Nobody cares about my movie!  I'm tryin' so hard, I don't know what else to do!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get angry at me.  Maybe you just need a day job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dolores, don't you understand?  I'm a director now!  I made "Glen Or Glenda."  Directing is my day job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I know is, ever since "Glen Or Glenda," all you do is booze it up and wear my clothes! Suddenly Paul hesitantly steps through the back gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yoo-hoo.  Excuse me!  Sorry to interrupt, but I got some big news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well my cousin Fred met this dame from back East.  She's from "old money," and he thinks she's loaded. And here's the kicker: She's very interested in the picture business! ANGLE - ED He slowly smiles. It's like sun breaking through rain clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. RESTAURANT PATIO - DAY We're at a fancy outdoor brunch.  Ed is shaking hands with pretty LORETTA KING, 25, a pale brunette in a classy dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleased to meet you.  I'm Loretta King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand you just moved here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Hollywood is oh so exciting. A WAITER walks over, with a water pitcher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water, Ma'am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  No water!  NO LIQUIDS!  I'm terribly allergic to them! The waiter is bewildered.  He hurries away.  Ed leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So my associate Mr. Marco tells me you may be interested in investing in a motion picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps a small amount of money. (she smiles) How much do one of your motion pictures cost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For this one, we need $60,000.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all??  That seems very reasonable for an entire picture. Ed perks up.  She's a live one! Ed pulls a script from his briefcase and hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps you'd like to look at the photoplay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my, this is very interesting. (she skims the pages) Say... do you think it would be possible for me to maybe play one of these parts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, of course!!  There's a couple characters you'd be perfect for: The secretary at the newspaper office, or the file clerk!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.  Those sound kind of small. (stopping at a page) Oh, here's one that looks good: Janet Lawton.  I'd sure like to play her. Ed blanches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: J-Janet Lawton???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Janet Layton is clearly the part to play.  She's got some real meaty scenes!  Can't you just see me in that part?? CU - ED He is aghast.  What a stomach-churning decision.  He stares at Loretta, then slowly croaks a response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... yeah... (beat) You'd be perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. ED AND DOLORES'S HOUSE - DAY We HEAR dishes being violently thrown.  Dolores SCREAMS inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard!  You two-timing, dress-wearing son-of-a-BITCH!! INT. HOUSE - SAME TIME Dolores is crying and screaming angrily.  Ed ducks the objects she hurls at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the only way I could get the movie made!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who do you think's been paying the rent?!  Who helped type your script, and did all your grunt work?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry!  What did you want me to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted you to say, "No!  I wrote the part for my girlfriend Dolores."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there's plenty of other parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what ?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The secretary.  Or the file clerk. Dolores is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! She hurls a pot at Ed.  WHACK!  It slams him in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SOUNDSTAGE - DAY The sets are being erected for "Bride Of The Atom"!  The crew hurries about the small stage, as Ed energetically supervises. He has a large band-aid on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is gonna be Bela's laboratory, so it should be real impressive! Like one of those mad scientist movies.  I want beakers, and test tubes, and one of those electrical things that buzzes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean a Tesla coil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you say so. Tor lumbers over, in his ripped Lobo outfit.  His face has fake gashed-up scars.  Tor holds the script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edvard!   I haf question 'bout script. My vife Greta, she read.  And she no like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?  Was the third act too intense?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  She tink Lobo is waste of my time.  Lobo don't talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Tor, it's a starring part! You're second billed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bela, he talk.  Loretta, she talk. But Tor, he no talk. Ed thinks.  He quickly puts a spin on this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tor, dialogue is overrated.  You look at the classic film actors, who are they?  Fairbanks.  Chaplin.  They didn't talk!  They did it all with their face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Greta say -- Loretta walks over, holding two dresses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie, which dress do you like better?
direction.name: direction
